TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
Hey there o/ 

Short question: for ordinary users like me, I can check the last seen online status, but that seem to be disabled for moderators?

Would be helpful to see who's online, if questions arise.

> 
> 
> 42 minutes ago, VoidSquid said:
> 
> 
> Would be helpful to see who's online, if questions arise.
> 

If there's a question you need one of the mod team to respond to, you can report the thread in question.  There really shouldn't be that many situations that are outside of an existing thread, but if there is, you can PM any of the mods you do see around regularly and we'll get to it as soon as we can.  If it's urgent, and doesn't pertain to a particular thread, you can always report any thread (one of the pinned locked threads is probably a good one) and any moderators that are on will see it.
That's not disabled for moderators. It's the "anonymous" setting that anyone can choose on the upper left-ish of your profile page.
what are the warning points/ what do they do?

> 
> 
> 11 minutes ago, Starhelperdude said:
> 
> 
> what are the warning points/ what do they do?
> 

They're an indication of how serious we consider the behavior to be. A zero point warn is just a formal reminder of our rules. 1-3 points means it's getting more serious. 5 points means your posts require moderator approval before they're visible for a while because we want to keep an eye on you. 10 total points earns you a 1-week ban because you did something significantly harmful. If you get up to 25 points that's a permanent ban. However, the points expire after a while. So the penalties only apply if you have that many *current*, non-expired points.
I usually see the streamers on twitch thing. Who and why get's to be featured there?

> 
> 
> 17 minutes ago, The Doodling Astronaut said:
> 
> 
> I usually see the streamers on twitch thing. Who and why get's to be featured there?
> 

That's a Squad staff thing. Moderators are not involved.

> 
>

> That's not disabled for moderators. It's the "anonymous" setting that anyone can choose on the upper left-ish of your profile page.
> 

Wondering, is that set automatically for all moderators? From what I can see (actually can't see), the profile information for all and every moderator does not provide that information.

> Wondering, is that set automatically for all moderators? From what I can see (actually can't see), the profile information for all and every moderator does not provide that information.

No, it's an option.

So you're telling me that \_all\_ and \_every\_ moderator have set that option set then. Right?
